body:
[P0] `onConnected` is no longer guaranteed to fire after `connect()` returns.

With the removal of `await onConnected()` here, the only remaining invocation is in `handlePush` on `.snapshot` (`apps/shared/MoltbotKit/Sources/MoltbotKit/GatewayNodeSession.swift:179-183`). If the socket connects but the snapshot never arrives (or arrives late, or is dropped on reconnect), callers that rely on `onConnected` being called after `connect()` completes may hang or mis-report connection state.

<details><summary>Prompt To Fix With AI</summary>

`````markdown
This is a comment left during a code review.
Path: apps/shared/MoltbotKit/Sources/MoltbotKit/GatewayNodeSession.swift
Line: 109:111

Comment:
[P0] `onConnected` is no longer guaranteed to fire after `connect()` returns.

With the removal of `await onConnected()` here, the only remaining invocation is in `handlePush` on `.snapshot` (`apps/shared/MoltbotKit/Sources/MoltbotKit/GatewayNodeSession.swift:179-183`). If the socket connects but the snapshot never arrives (or arrives late, or is dropped on reconnect), callers that rely on `onConnected` being called after `connect()` completes may hang or mis-report connection state.

How can I resolve this? If you propose a fix, please make it concise.
`````
</details>

[P2] `signedAtMs` is computed after awaiting `waitForConnectChallenge()`.

This shifts the signature timestamp later by up to `connectChallengeTimeoutSeconds` (0.75s) plus scheduling/network delay. It likely won’t break anything given server skew tolerance (10 min), but if the intent is “time when connect attempt started”, consider computing `signedAtMs` before the await for more stable/diagnostic-friendly timestamps.

<sub>Note: If this suggestion doesn't match your team's coding style, reply to this and let me know. I'll remember it for next time!</sub>
